channel.description: Recent content in Discrete Mathematics on

item.description: Files # https://youtube.com/playlist?list=PLxCzCOWd7aiH2wwES9vPWsEL6ipTaUSl3 Power Set # https://youtu.be/EaupQhQ4dsw?list=PLxCzCOWd7aiH2wwES9vPWsEL6ipTaUSl3: [[Math/Discrete Mathematics/Power Set|Power Set]]

If ‘A’ is a finite set then [[Math/Discrete Mathematics/Intro to Set Theory#Set|set]] of all [[Math/Discrete Mathematics/Intro to Set Theory#Subset|subsets]] of A is called power set of ‘A’. Example # A={1,2,3} P(A)={Φ,{1},{2},{3},{1,2},{2,3},{1,3},{1,2,3}} Property # If B∈P(A), then B⊆A Number of elements in Power Set # |A|=n |P(A)|=number of subsets of A=2ⁿ
